DOC.brief_summary: This non-inferiority , Phase II , open-label , randomize , parallel trial evaluate efficacy safety new intervention ( Dapaconazole cream 2 % ) versus active control ( Ketoconazole cream 2 % ) patient Tinea Pedis . Study schedule comprises enrollment , treatment follow-up visit . Treatment period 14 day .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Trial Comparing BL123 Versus Ketoconazole Patients With Tinea Pedis

Therefore , patient bilateral lesion , one foot allocate investigational product ( Dapaconazole ) foot allocate active control ( Ketoconazole ) . Randomization determine foot ( right left ) treat Dapaconazole Ketoconazole .
